page.title: 04BEAFORD YOUTH CLUB
page.content: The Beaford Youth Club was formed in May 1985, and uses the Beaford Village Hall as its base. The Club meets on a Thursday evening, commencing at 6.30 p.m. Children of ages 7 to 11 years attend the first part of the evening, until 7.30 p.m., when older children arrive. The Club has several facilities:- a mini pool table, a table-tennis table, a dart board, a skittle alley, a record player, and borrows P.E. mats from the school. Soft drinks, crisps and sweets can be purchased. The membership is 20p for an evening session, which ends at 9.30 p.m. The membership is not confined to Beaford, but accepts children from Roborough and St. Giles parishes also.
